intro: Dizygostemon, commonly known as the golden star tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its distinctive golden-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often aromatic, a common trait in the Lauraceae family. Dizygostemon typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
